document_data.name: Strohm III
document_data.mainbody: King '''Strohm III''' was a king of [[Tethyr]].
document_data.Description: Strohm III was rumored to have been a giant. In any case, he was peerless as a warrior, and many tales were told of his great prowess in combat.
document_data.Relationships:
Strohm III was the great-great-great-grandson of [[Strohm II]], who was a [[half-elf]] and thus long-lived, which was why Strohm III succeeded his great-great-great-grandfather as king of Tethyr instead of his own father.

Strohm III had at least three sons.
document_data.History:
Strohm III was born in the [[715 DR|Year of the Hungry Jaws, 715 DR]]. He was crowned king at the age of twenty years in the [[735 DR|Year of the Prophet's Child, 735 DR]].

Strohm III fought many wars during his reign as king,

Upon Strohm's death in [[769 DR]], his third son and a warrior like his father, [[Strohm IV]], became king in his stead.

[[Tomb of Strohm III|His tomb]] was located in the [[Windspear Hills]].
document_data.Rumors and Legends: A tale was often told of how Strohm and his general alone slew 5,000 drow during a battle that lasted two full days. This battle took place on a hill known as [[Argentor]] in the eastern [[Marching Mountains]] during a [[Wikipedia:en:Solar eclipse|solar eclipse]].
